Metrics¶

This section contains the various ready-to-use metrics that have been implemented so far.

Methods Summary

u8timeseries.metrics.mape(true_series, …)

Computes the Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE).

u8timeseries.metrics.mase(true_series, …)

Computes the Mean Absolute Scaled Error (MASE).

u8timeseries.metrics.overall_percentage_error(…)

Computes the Overall Percentage Erroe (OPE):

Methods Documentation

u8timeseries.metrics.mape(true_series: u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries, pred_series: u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries, time_diff: bool = False) → float[source]¶

Computes the Mean Absolute Percentage Error (MAPE).

This function computes the MAPE of pred_series with respect to true_series. Use time_diff=True when the time series has a strong auto-correlation to have a more accurate analysis. Use time_diff mainly when the time series are monotonic. Otherwise, it will be difficult to analyze the results.

Parameters

  • true_series – A TimeSeries.

  • pred_series – A TimeSeries to be compared with true_series.

  • time_diff – If True, analyze the time differentiated series, instead of the index one.

Returns

A float, the MAPE of pred_series with respect to true_series.

u8timeseries.metrics.mase(true_series: u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries, pred_series: u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries, m: int = 1, time_diff: bool = False) → float[source]¶

Computes the Mean Absolute Scaled Error (MASE).

This function computes the MASE of pred_series with respect to true_series and the seasonal period m. Use time_diff=True when the time series has a strong auto-correlation to have a more accurate analysis.

Parameters

  • true_series – A TimeSeries.

  • pred_series – A TimeSeries to be compared with true_series.

  • m – A int, the seasonality period to take into account. If None, try to infer one from ACF

  • time_diff – If True, analyze the time differentiated series, instead of the index one.

Returns

A float, the MASE of pred_series with respect to true_series.

u8timeseries.metrics.overall_percentage_error(true_series: u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries, pred_series: u8timeseries.timeseries.TimeSeries, time_diff: bool = False) → float[source]¶

Computes the Overall Percentage Erroe (OPE):

This function computes the OPE of pred_series with respect to true_series. Use time_diff=True when the time series has a strong auto-correlation to have a more accurate analysis. Use time_diff mainly when the time series are monotonic. Otherwise, it will be difficult to analyze the results.

Parameters

  • true_series – A TimeSeries.

  • pred_series – A TimeSeries to be compared with true_series.

  • time_diff – If True, analyze the time differentiated series, instead of the index one.

Returns

A float, the OPE of pred_series with respect to true_series.
